title: NASA Sets Coverage for Northrop Grumman Cygnus Departure from Station
summary: Carrying more than 8,200 pounds of supplies, scientific investigations, commercial products, hardware, and other cargo to the orbiting laboratory for NASA, Northrop Grumman’s uncrewed Cygnus spacecraft is scheduled to depart the International Space Station Friday, April 21.

title: Europe’s Ariane 6 rocket is turning into a space policy disaster
summary: Now the Ariane 6 rocket is failing even its most basic task.

title: Axiom announces new government human spaceflight program
summary: Axiom Space has introduced a new program to allow countries to create human spaceflight programs without needing to develop their own infrastructure or other capabilities.

title: Inmarsat working to restore L-band services in Asia Pacific after satellite outage
summary: An aging Inmarsat satellite that pilots use to keep in touch with air traffic control beyond the range of very high frequency (VHF) ground radars is experiencing a prolonged outage.

title: Northrop Grumman clears design hurdle for military communications satellite
summary: Northrop Grumman completed a critical design review of a Space Development Agency communications satellite in 13 months, a fraction of the time required for traditional space programs.
